Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: நயனிலன் என்பது சொல்லும் பயனிலபாரித் துரைக்கும் உரை.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: That conversation in which a man utters forth useless things will say of him "he is without virtue".

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is speaking at great length, elaborating on a useless and trivial topic ('பயனில பாரித்து உரைக்கும்').
Layered_Composition.Midground: The words themselves are personified. As they leave the speaker's mouth, they do not talk about the trivial subject matter. Instead, they turn back and point at the speaker.
Layered_Composition.Background: The personified words are shown to be speaking a single, clear judgment about their own creator. The judgment, which materializes in the air, is: 'This man is without virtue or goodness' ('நயன் இலன் என்பது'). The man's own speech testifies against his character.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A person's long-winded and elaborate speech on a useless topic is itself a direct proclamation that the speaker lacks virtue.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The personification of the words as witnesses against their own speaker is the central, surreal concept. The speech becomes a self-indictment. The length and elaboration of the speech ('பாரித்து') make the indictment even stronger.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A neutral, observational light. The surreal event of the words turning back to testify is the main focus. The visualized words of judgment might have a cold, judgmental glow.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A shot that follows the words from the speaker's mouth and then shows them turning around to point back and deliver their verdict.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with advanced effects for the personified, speaking words.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: The speech itself should be lit in a way that reveals its empty character.

Cultural_Anchors: Speech that elaborates on useless things (பயனில பாரித்து உரைக்கும் உரை)
Will say, 'He is without virtue' (நயன் இலன் என்பது சொல்லும்)
